entry.title: Bureau of Land Management plans trail maintenance day for Susan Creek Falls
entry.summary: Every Sept. 27, organizations across the country celebrate National Public Lands Day, a holiday dedicated to the conservation of public lands and the enrichment they bring to communities.

entry.title: Winston’s Now N Then Antique Mall Closing After 19 Years
entry.summary: Winston’s Now N Then Antique Mall may close Oct. 3 after 19 years unless an attorney can secure a lease extension. Specials include 50% off items marked 22 or 222. Vendors notified, showcases for sale, and a final parking lot sale may be held.

entry.title: Dancing in the street at the Umpqua Valley Farmer's Market
entry.summary: Corazón Oaxaqueño took over the center of the Umpqua Valley Farmers Market for more than an hour Saturday, performing three dances that each ran about 15 minutes and resembled short musicals. The routines included themes, plots and even a bullfight.

entry.title: DFPA to Issue Prescribed Pasture Burn Permits, Backyard Debris Burns Still Restricted
entry.summary: DFPA will issue permits for prescribed pasture burns to improve grazing lands and reduce wildfire risk. Backyard debris burning remains closed. Learn more about prescribed fire: https://extension.oregonstate.edu/collection/prescribed-fire-basics

entry.title: Dowdy Sentenced to More Than 20 Years for Fatal Crash Involving UCC Softball Team
entry.summary: Johnathan James Dowdy, 33, of Coos Bay, was sentenced to 20 years and six months in prison for the April 18 crash that killed UCC softball player Kiley Jones and head coach Jami Strinz, and injured teammates. Victims and families shared emotional statements during sentencing.

entry.title: Community Support Needed: Lookingglass Rural Fire District Seeks Grant for Lifesaving Cardiac Monitor
entry.summary: Lookingglass Rural Fire District is seeking community letters of support for a $15,000 Ford Family Foundation grant to help buy a Zoll X-Series Cardiac Monitor. The device will cut costs, speed patient transfers, and improve emergency care as call volumes rise. Email captain@lookingglassfire.org
